result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert N Meyeroff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate State/County Institution Laws, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/17/22.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/17/22 and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay ALL, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert N Meyeroff

defendant.name: Meyeroff, Robert N
defendant.address: Robert Meyeroff Law Office SC 633 West  Wisconsin, Milwaukee, WI 53203

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 10 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/17/22.
- Withdraw from the cases placed on the record.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/17/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Robert N Meyeroff in court.  
Attorney Matthew Westphal for Nicolas J Heitman in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Defendant has not complied with the terms of the DPA.  Court ordered a judgment of conviction be entered.

Defendant Robert N Meyeroff in court.  
Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Early review hearing on defendant's DPA held at the request of the state.   ADA Heitman informed the Court the defendant has not been complying with the DPA and has filed briefs with the Court of Appeals.  ADA Heitman requests a sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.

Defendant Robert N Meyeroff in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Review hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
